title: Move localized price from Landing to Input & Payment, add new Landing hero image

requirements.summary: Remove localized price UI from the Landing screen and drop any Landing dependency on regional pricing logic.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing screen no longer renders the price label or localized amount.
Landing screen no longer depends on the regional pricing hook just to show price (no unused pricing UI remains).

file_operations.description: Remove the regional pricing hook usage and delete the price label/amount section so no currency/amount is shown on Landing. Ensure related imports/variables are removed to avoid unused pricing UI remnants.

requirements.summary: Show the localized price within the Input & Payment flow prior to starting caricature generation using the existing regional pricing logic.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user is on the Input & Payment screen (before generation starts), the localized price is visible.
Price shown uses the existing regional price detection (ipapi-based) and formatting already used elsewhere.

file_operations.description: Ensure the localized price section is clearly visible in the pre-generation portion of the Input & Payment flow (before generation starts), continuing to use the existing useRegionalPrice hook output (priceDisplay) and existing i18n labels. Keep the backend and payment logic unchanged.

requirements.summary: Replace the removed Landing price area with a new static hero illustration image and keep the layout responsive.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing screen displays the new static image asset in place of the removed price section.
The image is loaded as a static frontend asset (not fetched via the backend).
Landing layout remains responsive and visually balanced at mobile and desktop widths.

file_operations.description: Add the required static hero illustration asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/landing-hero.dim_1200x600.png (Caricature-themed hero illustration banner).

Render the new static hero image (frontend/public/assets/generated/landing-hero.dim_1200x600.png) in the UI where the price section used to be. Use responsive layout/styling so it looks balanced on mobile and desktop, and ensure it is referenced as a static frontend asset (not via backend fetch).
